summary: This is an educational article by Dr. Camila Williams about the emotional stages and treatment following sexual trauma, published on GoodTherapy.org. It describes four common emotional stages (guilt/shame, blame/anger, grieving/mourning, fear/anxiety) and outlines therapeutic approaches for each. The document appears to be general educational material and does not contain specific case information about Jeffrey Epstein or his associates.

persons.name: Camila Williams
persons.context: Author of the educational article about emotional stages after sexual trauma, identified as a PhD and therapist in Torrance, California.

events.title: Publication of Sexual Trauma Article
events.description: Dr. Camila Williams publishes an educational article titled '4 Stages of Emotions and Treatment After Sexual Trauma' on GoodTherapy.org.

events.title: Sexual Assault Awareness Month
events.description: The article notes that April is Sexual Assault Awareness Month and mentions various awareness events happening throughout the country.

keyFacts: This document is general educational material about sexual trauma recovery, not specific to the Epstein case.
The article outlines four emotional stages after sexual trauma: guilt/shame, blame/anger, grieving/mourning, and fear/anxiety.
The author emphasizes that sexual trauma is never the victim's fault and focuses on therapeutic approaches for each stage.
The document was published on April 18, 2018, during Sexual Assault Awareness Month.
No specific individuals from the Epstein case are mentioned in this document.
